courseObjectives: To develop mathematical skills for solving computer science problems.
courseOutcomes: MA501.1 Solve a homogeneous and non-homogeneous system of linear equations using rank of a matrix.
MA501.2 Solve system of linear equations by Numerical Methods.
MA501.3 Solve equations in real life problems and to encode and decode messages using the concept of matrices.
MA501.4 Identify whether given structures are vector spaces and subspaces and construct a basis for them.
MA501.5 Show if a given matrix is diagonalizable or not.
MA501.6 Apply concepts of eigenvalues and eigenvectors to calculate functions of a square matrix, Google page rank vector and solve systems of differential equations.

modules.title: Basics of matrices
topics: Revision of basic matrices and types of matrices
Row echelon form, Reduced Row Echelon form, Rank of a matrix

modules.title: Linear equations & its solutions
topics: Consistency and solution of simultaneous linear homogeneous and non-homogeneous equations
Application of solving systems of equations in traffic control
Solution by Gauss Elimination, Gauss Jordan, Gauss Jacobi, Gauss Seidel, LU Decomposition - Croutâ€™s method

modules.title: Vector spaces
topics: Vector space, subspace, span, linear dependence and independence of vectors
Basis, dimension, orthogonal projection & Gram-Schmidt process

modules.title: Encoding & decoding using Matrices
topics: Application of matrices to coding and decoding

modules.title: Eigenvalues and Eigenvectors
topics: Diagonalisation of matrices, Application to find Google page rank

modules.title: Self-Study Topics
topics: Normal form, Solving KVL circuits using matrices, Singular Value Decomposition
Quadratic forms, Spectral theorem for Hermitian matrices

modification_suggestion: No matching topic found for this subject. Consider reviewing the syllabus content.

courseObjectives: To learn fundamentals of Data Structures.
courseOutcomes: MC501.1 Apply various operations of Stack, Queue and Linked List to solve problems from different domains.
MC501.2 Apply various operations of Tree and Graph to solve problems from different domains.
MC501.3 Make use of searching and hashing techniques for efficient data retrieval and data mapping.
MC501.4 Compare efficiency of various sorting algorithms.

modules.title: Introduction to Data Structure and Algorithms
topics: Introduction to Time and Space Complexity

modules.title: Linked List, Stack and Queue
topics: Linked List as an ADT, Types of Linked List (Singly, Doubly, Circular), Operations of Linked List
Applications of Linked List: Polynomial addition and subtraction
Stack ADT, Stack operations, Applications of Stack: Postfix expression evaluation, Infix to Postfix conversion
Queue ADT, Queue operations, Circular Queue, Priority Queue, Applications of Queue: Round Robin CPU Scheduling

modules.title: Tree and Graph
topics: Binary Tree, Binary Search Tree, Expression Tree, Huffman Tree, AVL Tree, B Tree, Heap Tree
Graph Representation, Graph Traversal Techniques, Shortest Path Algorithms

modules.title: Searching and Hashing Techniques
topics: Sequential Search, Binary Search, Interpolation Search
Hashing Techniques and Collision resolution techniques

modules.title: Sorting Techniques
topics: Internal Sorting Techniques: Bubble Sort, Insertion Sort, Selection Sort, Radix Sort, Quick Sort, Heap Sort

modules.title: Self-Study Topics
topics: Applications of Linked list: Sparse Matrix and other real life applications
Applications of Stack: Recursion and other real life applications

courseObjectives: To be familiar with a broad range of mathematical objects like sets, functions, relational graphs that is omnipresent in computer science.
courseOutcomes: MA502.1 Construct simple mathematical proofs and verify them.
MA502.2 Apply core ideas of Set Theory, Logic, Relations Functions, and Recurrence Relations.
MA502.3 Solve examples using graphs, trees and their various types with their traversing techniques.

modules.title: Set Theory and Logic
topics: Union, Intersection, Disjoint, and Difference of two sets
Relations and Diagraphs - Properties of Relations

modules.title: Relational Structures on Sets: Relations & Graphs
Sizes of Sets: Counting & Combinatorics
topics: Linear Recurrence relations - methods of solutions

modules.title: Structured Sets: Algebraic Structures
topics: Structured sets with respect to binary operations
Groups, Semigroups, Monoids, Rings, and Fields

courseObjectives: To learn the fundamentals of database systems.
courseOutcomes: MC502.1 Design ER diagram and relational database.

MC502.3 Analyze transaction and concurrency control mechanism.
MC502.4 Illustrate emerging database systems.
MC502.5 Formulate SQL queries for information retrieval.

modules.title: Query Optimization, Normalization and Functional Dependencies

Recovery Techniques based on Deferred and Immediate Update, Shadow paging, ARIES recovery algorithm

modules.title: Distributed and Parallel Database

modules.title: XML and Object-Based Databases
topics: XML documents, Approaches to store XML documents, Extracting XML documents from Relational Database

topics: Tuple Relational Calculus and Domain Relational Calculus

courseObjectives: This course is designed to provide the core knowledge necessary to understand DevOps concepts, its principles and practices and tools.
courseOutcomes: MC520.1 To understand basic concepts of DevOps.
MC520.2 Install, configure & use container technologies.
MC520.3 Apply testing tools for software, quality code & security testing.
MC520.4 Deploy and continuous monitoring of systems.

modules.title: Overview of DevOps
topics: Introduction to DevOps: Define the concept of DevOps, explain its origins, and describe its benefits and challenges.

modules.title: Git, Jenkins, Ansible Integration
topics: Branching and Merging in Git, Git workflows.

modules.title: Containerization with Docker
topics: Understanding images and containers, Running Hello World in Docker.

modules.title: Containerization using Kubernetes
topics: Cluster Architecture, Spinning up a Kubernetes Cluster on Ubuntu VMs.

modules.title: Functional Testing and Continuous Monitoring
topics: Security Testing, Continuous Monitoring with Nagios.
